Directions: Read the passage and then answer each question. There are four underlined words or phrases in the passage to show which word or phrase may be incorrect.
Content: From ancient Greece to Broadway, live performances have been part of society for thousands of years. W͟h͟i͟l͟e͟ ͟t͟h͟e͟a͟t͟e͟r͟ ͟d͟o͟e͟s͟n͟’͟t͟ ͟f͟a͟s͟c͟i͟n͟a͟t͟e͟ ͟e͟v͟e͟r͟y͟o͟n͟e͟,͟ ͟m͟a͟n͟y͟ ͟p͟e͟o͟p͟l͟e͟ ͟l͟o͟v͟e͟ ͟t͟h͟e͟m͟. Drama can help people learn about themselves and others.

Performing involves both teamwork and i͟n͟d͟i͟v͟i͟d͟u͟e͟l practice. Most shows require auditions, meaning that actors must try out in front of the director or judges in order to be cast in a production. Actors rehearse their scenes together before the first performance of their shows. Once actors are on stage, they need to avoid m͟i͟s͟t͟a͟k͟e͟s͟ ͟b͟e͟c͟a͟u͟s͟e͟ ͟t͟h͟e͟y͟ ͟w͟i͟l͟l͟ ͟h͟a͟v͟e͟ ͟t͟o͟ ͟t͟h͟i͟n͟k͟ ͟o͟n͟ ͟t͟h͟e͟i͟r͟ ͟f͟e͟e͟t͟ ͟.͟.͟.͟ ͟t͟o͟ ͟f͟i͟x͟ ͟t͟h͟e͟m͟. There are no second chances in front of a live audience. It may be a lot of pressure, but that is part of the fun of theater.

The Florida Children’s Theatre is an organization founded in 1952 that teaches drama and musical performance. Children and teens make up most of the actors. B͟o͟t͟h͟ ͟t͟h͟e͟ ͟c͟l͟a͟s͟s͟e͟s͟ ͟a͟n͟d͟ ͟t͟h͟e͟ ͟t͟e͟a͟c͟h͟e͟r͟s͟ ͟a͟r͟e͟ ͟p͟o͟p͟u͟l͟a͟r͟,͟ ͟a͟n͟d͟ ͟t͟h͟e͟y͟ ͟a͟r͟e͟ ͟e͟x͟p͟e͟r͟t͟s͟ ͟i͟n͟ ͟t͟h͟e͟i͟r͟ ͟f͟i͟e͟l͟d͟. Students learn a range of skills from acting basics to advanced methods. Programs like this can be found across the United States. As old as theater is, people will always try to make it fresh and exciting.
